case_vignette: A 61-year-old woman presents concerned about a white discoloration on her left breast that she first noticed 6 months earlier! It itches at times, and she is worried it might be cancerous! She showed it to her gynecologist at her annual visit, and he referred her to the dermatology clinic! Physical examination of the left breast reveals a 10-cm white, smooth, porcelain-like plaque! There is no associated erythema and no noticeable scale!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I am concerned about a white discoloration on my left breast that sometimes itches.
How long have you noticed this discoloration and itching?
I first noticed the discoloration 6 months ago.
Do you have any other symptoms such as pain, discharge, or changes in skin texture around the affected area?
No, there is no pain, discharge, or changes in skin texture around the affected area.
Have you been exposed to sunlight or have used any new skincare or laundry products recently?
I can't specify about sunlight exposure or new product usage.
Do you have any personal or family history of skin conditions or autoimmune diseases?
I can't provide information about my personal or family history of skin conditions or autoimmune diseases.
Have you noticed any similar patches elsewhere on your body?
No, I have not noticed similar patches elsewhere on my body.
Final Diagnosis: Vitiligo
